shortdesc.ph: Enable/disable the review of video streams both at the client side and the Agora cloud content review server.

p.codeblock: public abstract int enableContentInspect(boolean enabled, ContentInspectConfig config);
virtual int enableContentInspect(bool enabled, const ContentInspectConfig& config) = 0;
public abstract int EnableContentInspect(bool enabled, ContentInspectConfig config);

section.p: When video content inspection is enabled, the SDK takes screenshots, reviews, and uploads videos sent by local users based on the type and frequency of the content inspection module you set in . After content inspection, the Agora content inspection server sends the results to your app server in HTTPS requests and sends all screenshots to the third-party cloud storage service.

If you set the type in the to identify yellow, after the review is completed, the SDK will trigger a callback to report the result of the yellow verification.
Before calling this method, ensure that the following requirements are met:
Submit a ticket to activate Agora Cloud Converged Video Content Review Service.
Integrate the libagora_ci_extension.dlllibagora_ci_extension.soAgoraCIExtension.xcframeworkAgoraCIExtension.framework dynamic library into the project.
The following dynamic libraries have been integrated into the project:
Android: libagora_ci_extension.so
AgoraCIExtension.xcframework
iOS/macOS: AgoraCIExtension.xcframework
Windows: libagora_ci_extension.dll

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable content inspection.
: Turn on.
: Off.
